src.measure.edgespeed module

src.measure.edgespeed.count11(seq)[source]

count the lenghth of first consecutive ‘1’s in binary sequence

Parameters

seq (np.array((N,),dtype=bool)) – binary time series

Returns

length – lenghth of first consecutive ‘1’s

Return type

int

src.measure.edgespeed.line_intensity(pointxy, pointuv, im, maxlength=20)[source]

intensity of pixels along the line that start front pointxy in the direction of pointuv

Parameters

  • pointxy (np.array((2,),dtype=int)) – x,y coordinates of point

  • pointuv (np.array((2,),dtype=int)) – u,v coordinates of point

  • im (np.array((X,Y),dtype=bool)) – single frame of new excitation image

  • maxlength (int) – maximum length of the line

Returns

lineim – intensity of pixels along the line sorted by distance to the startxy in ascending order

Return type

np.array((N,),dtype=bool)

src.measure.edgespeed.point_velocity(blobs, NEWEXC, outline)[source]

centered cross correlation of two time series

Parameters

  • NEWEXC (np.array((T,X,Y),dtype=bool)) – new excitation mask

  • outline (np.array((X,Y),dtype=bool)) – mask of pixels in embryo

Returns

  • speed ((# evenly spaced points along contour,)) – distance from point to edge of new excitation regions

  • speedmsk (np.array((T,X,Y),dtype=np.float32)) – pixel value represents amplitude of edge propagation. pixels outside of embryo are labeled -1

src.measure.edgespeed.rect_zxy(p, imshape, L=(0, 5), W=3)[source]

find pixels in the bounding rectangle of a vector

Parameters

  • p (dict) – vector {‘xy’:xy,’uv’:uv}

  • imshape (tuple) – dimensions of image (X,Y)

  • L (tuple) – relative start and end points of the rectangle along the vector

  • W (int) – dimention of rectangle perpendicular to the vector

Returns

  • rectx (np.array((N,),dtype=int)) – x coordinate of pixels in rectangle

  • recty (np.array((N,),dtype=int)) – y coordinate of pixels in rectangle

src.measure.edgespeed.rectangle(p, q, W)[source]

locate the x,y coordinates of the bounding rectangle of a vector

Parameters

  • p (int) – start point of vector

  • q (int) – end point of vector

Returns

length – lenghth of first consecutive ‘1’s

Return type

int
